body.header: What will I learn in this unit?
body.section:
Conservation (social context)You will listen to two friends travelling by plane talking about the trip.
Monologue (educational context)You will listen to a lecture about a small tribe of Native Americans.
Question typesYou will attempt two question types.Multiple choice - Picture optionsMultiple choice - Text options

section.p: You are given a question and usually four pictures from which to select the answer. Look at the pictures and decide what they represent before listening.
Try to work out what the listening text will be about from the vocabulary of the questions and the pictures.
Decide what you need to listen for.
Underline the key words in the questions.

p.font: If you don’t know the meaning of any of the words in the questions look at the pictures. You may be able to guess the meaning from something that recurs in them.

section.p: Answer the questions as you listen.
The information will be given in the same order as the questions although it may be expressed differently.
You are given a question and three or four possible answers from which you must choose one.
Read the instructions carefully. Make sure you only have to circle one letter.
Look at the vocabulary of the questions and try to work out what you are going to hear.
Underline the key words in the questions.
Decide what you need to listen for.
You may be able to predict one or two of the answers. You may be able to eliminate answers too.
If you don't know the meaning of any of the words in the questions look at the other questions. They might have some associated vocabulary in them to help you guess the meaning.
Listen out for words of similar meaning to words in the answer choices.
Answer the questions as you listen.
